description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


The AWS Networking organization is hiring, and we’re looking for talented Network Development Engineers (NDE) to join our team. Within Networking, we’re confronting and solving complex and high-stake challenges. Our teams support all aspects of connectivity to/from Amazon and the outside world, as well as the connectivity between Amazon’s data centers and services. As a member of one our network engineering teams, you will play a part in designing and architecting networks that simply cannot fail, must scale infinitely, and can never constrain growth or innovation.

This opportunity sits within our Internet Services organization where the team is responsible for designing the networks connecting Amazon directly to the outside world (including the Internet, peers, and external customers), evolving the global backbone that interconnects our Regions as well as partnering with our internal customers. Engineers in this organization define routing policy, design and implement Traffic Engineering solutions, as well as architect the hardware platforms and network design to support internal and external connectivity. We move terabits of traffic in and out of our networks each day and are responsible for the ingress and egress points of traffic entering and leaving Amazon as well as the entirety of all internal and customer traffic that rides our global backbone. Engineers on this team make day-to-day and strategic decisions that carry a huge amount of responsibility and impact.



Responsibilities



As a Network Development Engineer at Amazon, your core job responsibility is to design network topologies, architectures, and services that solve for many requirements. We listen to our customers (both internal and external), but we also listen to our teams. Our Engineers contribute materially to each team’s roadmap, and constantly help us to determine what’s most important. Together, you and your leadership team will decide on the projects that best support your team’s mission. You will have the resources and time necessary to understand, scope, and deliver these solutions. The primary area of responsibility you and your team will have is to design ahead of customer or technology needs, always predicting and solving for problems that have not yet occurred. This takes the form of creating and defending High Level Design (HLD) documents, working with vendors or internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps, constructing and testing your solutions, and providing support to the teams that will deploy and operate these designs. Our teams also serve as technical escalation points in support of our very talented operations teams.

Key job responsibilities

An Internet Edge NDE at AWS is responsible for providing our customers world class Internet connectivity by optimizing for security, availability, performance, and cost. We do this by setting network standards and creating scalable designs that our customers love.

A day in the life

We partner with customer and stakeholder teams, meeting with both to ensure we capture requirements and user experience stories to better equip ourselves with the tools we need to provide the highest performing network we can.



About The Team



We are based in Seattle, but have flexibility to support remote engineering throughout the west coast of North America.




Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor’s Degree in a technology related field or equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree

 8+ years professional experience working in large scale networking environments.

 5+ years of experience with internet routing protocols and concepts: TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS, ISIS and/or OSPF

 5+ years of experience with network operating systems such as Cisco IOS and Junos.

 5+ years of experience working in a Linux/Unix environment

 5+ years of experience in automation via Bash/shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.

Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


The AWS Networking organization is hiring, and we’re looking for talented Network Development Engineers (NDE) to join our team. Within Networking, we’re confronting and solving complex and high-stake challenges. Our teams support all aspects of connectivity to/from Amazon and the outside world, as well as the connectivity between Amazon’s data centers and services. As a member of one our network engineering teams, you will play a part in designing and architecting networks that simply cannot fail, must scale infinitely, and can never constrain growth or innovation.

This opportunity sits within our Internet Services organization where the team is responsible for designing the networks connecting Amazon directly to the outside world (including the Internet, peers, and external customers), evolving the global backbone that interconnects our Regions as well as partnering with our internal customers. Engineers in this organization define routing policy, design and implement Traffic Engineering solutions, as well as architect the hardware platforms and network design to support internal and external connectivity. We move terabits of traffic in and out of our networks each day and are responsible for the ingress and egress points of traffic entering and leaving Amazon as well as the entirety of all internal and customer traffic that rides our global backbone. Engineers on this team make day-to-day and strategic decisions that carry a huge amount of responsibility and impact.



Responsibilities



As a Network Development Engineer at Amazon, your core job responsibility is to design network topologies, architectures, and services that solve for many requirements. We listen to our customers (both internal and external), but we also listen to our teams. Our Engineers contribute materially to each team’s roadmap, and constantly help us to determine what’s most important. Together, you and your leadership team will decide on the projects that best support your team’s mission. You will have the resources and time necessary to understand, scope, and deliver these solutions. The primary area of responsibility you and your team will have is to design ahead of customer or technology needs, always predicting and solving for problems that have not yet occurred. This takes the form of creating and defending High Level Design (HLD) documents, working with vendors or internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps, constructing and testing your solutions, and providing support to the teams that will deploy and operate these designs. Our teams also serve as technical escalation points in support of our very talented operations teams.

We’re interested in engineers with experience having designed, operated, and implemented networks of very large scale, and those well versed in the operation of the Internet routing hierarchy. Candidates should understand the theory behind and have deep operational knowledge of routing protocols with particular emphasis on their impact to hardware platforms. We’re looking for those who have pushed platforms to their limits, understand how to work within the limitations imposed by third-party software and how to avoid them through your designs.

TRREB
 currently has an opportunity for an 
Network/Systems Administrator
 to fill a full-time, permanent position in the Information Services department. The successful candidate will report directly to the Manager, IT Operations and will be responsible for the duties outlined below.



Primary Responsibilities



The Network/Systems Administrator is responsible for end-user support, network administration, and systems administration. The incumbent will provide end-user technical support in-person and remotely and also deploy, maintain, and administer computer networks and all IT infrastructure components including end-user devices (computers, laptops, tablets, mobile phones), servers (Windows/macOS/Linux), systems software, web/application servers, network infrastructure components (switches, wireless APs, wireless controllers, firewalls) across all locations and environments. The incumbent will also develop, administer and maintain network and server infrastructure to the highest standard while ensuring security, integrity and high-availability of all enterprise systems and related components.

A creative thinker and fast learner with a calm, focused approach to problem-solving, positive attitude, client-oriented mindset, and excellent verbal and written communication skills are required.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES



Provide onsite and remote technical support for issues related to Windows/Mac devices (computers, laptops, and mobile devices), software applications, printers, peripherals, UPS, and components, liaising with hardware and software vendors, as required.

Resolve technical support tickets and requests in a timely and efficient manner based on priority and impact, including maintaining knowledgebase documentations.

Identify, diagnose, and resolve network problems including network connectivity, traffic utilization, etc. using available network tools in a timely fashion.

Build, maintain, monitor, and optimize Microsoft Windows/Linux/Mac servers in both a physical and virtual environment.

Maintain and administer LAN/WLAN/WAN network infrastructure components and services while ensuring that appropriate security measures are in place to avoid unauthorized access and reporting any unusual activity/access to the Manager, IT Operations.

Maintain a Microsoft Active Directory environment with Windows/Mac clients and Windows/Mac/Linux servers including managing Group Policies and all network services (Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, file/print sharing, SFTP, RADIUS, and Web services).

Configure and maintain network devices and solutions including Cisco Catalyst/Meraki switches, Cisco/Meraki access points, network printers, ASA firewalls, and enterprise endpoint protection, while ensuring that all enterprise systems and connectivity are adequately secured.

Routinely check network systems and equipment for substandard performance or malfunctioning, ensuring that any warning signs are quickly responded to and do not become major problems.

Properly apply system updates, patches, and configuration changes as per established procedures and best practices.

Liaise with service providers (WAN, VOIP, and Managed Services) to ensure availability of key systems and services.

Set up laptops/projectors/phone equipment for meetings/seminars as required.

Create, request, and present technical specifications and requirements for purchasing of new devices and solutions and coordinating with vendors and suppliers for IT purchases, solutions, and maintenance/support.

Participate in the creation, maintenance, testing, and execution of a Disaster Recovery plan and ensure that all end-user and server systems are appropriately backed up and reviewed regularly to ensure they are operating as required.

Maintain UPS, water and temperature sensors.

Set up user accounts, permissions and passwords,

Assist with communications and connectivity services, including Internet, VOIP, fax services, etc.

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related with servers and network topology, equipment, and configurations, including network design and diagrams, and ensure the timely review and update of the documentation.

Frequently meet to review IT infrastructure processes and procedures, and recommend corrective actions needed to gain efficiencies and productivity.

Train staff on TRREB supported technologies.

Occasionally mentor and train junior IT staff on the team.

Assist with other TRREB special events, including on-site assistance as required.

Perform other duties as requested from time to time.




Education




REQUIREMENTS



Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Information Technology or related field of study.

Technical Certifications (Cisco, Microsoft, AWS, Azure, etc.) would be an asset.




Experience




4 to 5 years of hands-on experience providing IT support, systems administration, and infrastructure administration.

Expert knowledge of computer and server hardware and components. Proficient in configuring, installing, and troubleshooting systems running Windows 10, Windows Server 2008-2019, macOS, MS Office (on both Windows and Mac), and Office 365.

Intermediate experience in configuring, troubleshooting and administering Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policies, DHCP, DNS, VPN (IPsec/SSL), SSL/TLS, HTTP/HTTPS, switching and routing protocols (STP, EIGRP, VTP), and client- and server-based networking, and Cisco devices (switches, ASA firewalls, WLC, access points).

Experience in deploying functional networks (LAN, WLAN, WAN) and their associated technologies and protocols.

Strong experience in network/systems monitoring and management.

Must be interested in building expertise in the following technologies: Microsoft Office 365, Mobile Device Management, Windows Azure, Amazon Web Services, and VMware.

Excellent customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.

Organized, reliable, highly dedicated with a positive attitude.

Keen eye for detail with decision-making, problem solving, and analytical skills.

Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently.

Ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.




Health And Safety Responsibilities



The incumbent will follow safe work procedures, knowing and complying with all health and safety regulations. Personal protection and safety equipment will be used if/when required. Any injury or illness, unsafe acts or unsafe conditions must be reported immediately to their Supervisor.


SPECIAL WORKING CONDITIONS



Occasional overtime, on-call support and after-hours work may be required.

Heavy lifting is required for this position. Must be able to lift and transport moderately heavy objects (computers, servers, devices, and printers) on a regular basis.

This position may be exposed to highly confidential material and/or information. Every effort must be made to ensure that sensitive information and/or materials that are critical in nature are properly stored and secured.
